definitions.definition: come or go back to a place or person.
examples: he returned to Canada in the fall

definitions.definition: go back to (a particular state or activity).
examples: Ollie had returned to full health

definitions.definition: (especially of a feeling) come back or recur after a period of absence.
give, put, or send (something) back to a place or person.
examples: complete the application form and return it to this address
synonyms: reinstall "Peter returned the book to the shelf"

definitions.definition: feel, say, or do (the same feeling, action, etc.) in response.
synonyms: give back More"she returned his kiss"answer

definitions.definition: (in tennis and other sports) hit or send (the ball) back to an opponent.
examples: hit back, throw back he returned the volley

definitions.definition: run upfield with the ball after fielding (a kick), intercepting (a pass), or recovering (a fumble).
(of a judge or jury) state or present (a verdict) in response to a formal request.
examples: deliver, bring in, hand down the jury returned a unanimous verdict

definitions.definition: lead (a card of a suit led earlier by one's partner).
continue (a wall) in a changed direction, especially at right angles.

examples: the company returned a profit of 4.3 million dollars

definitions.definition: (of an electorate) elect (a person or party) to office.
examples: the Democrat was returned in the third district
synonyms: select "the swing might result in a leftist party being returned in the next election"
